summary: The 'Stop RFK's Bad Science Act' mandates the National Institutes of Health (NIH) to reinstate terminated or suspended grants and awards, effective upon the bill's enactment. Unless there is financial mismanagement, research fraud, or malfeasance found by the Director, the reinstated grants are to be considered obligated. Payment requests for these grants should be disbursed within 30 days.  The bill also extends the budget period of affected grants by one year. Key definitions related to NIH grants and awards are also provided.
